qas.question: What was the electronic eavesdropping system used by the FBI during the Clinton presidency?
When did the FBI abandon Carnivore?
What kind of software replaced Carnivore?
What was the name DCS1000 changed to?
What software system received prolonged positive coverage in the press?
What administration did the CIA implement Carnivore under?
In what year did the FBI stop using commercially available software?
What is an example of software that is not available commercially?

context: <a0_0><b6_0>Carnivore<b6_0/><a0_0/> was an electronic eavesdropping software system implemented by the FBI during the <b7_0>Clinton<b7_0/> administration; it was designed to monitor <a1_0>email and electronic communications<a1_0/>. After prolonged negative coverage in the press, the FBI changed the name of its system from "<b5_0>Carnivore<b5_0/>" to "<a2_0>DCS1000<a2_0/>." DCS is reported to stand for "Digital Collection System"; the system has the same functions as before. The Associated Press reported in mid-January <b8_0>2005<b8_0/> that the FBI essentially abandoned the use of Carnivore in <a3_0>2001<a3_0/>, in favor of <a4_0>commercially available<a4_0/> software, such as <b9_0>NarusInsight<b9_0/>.
